36232689.review:
This is a must try VR app for HTC Vive. Mindshow is the ultimate interactive sandbox for setting up your own scenes and acting them out. You can drop in characters and act out the scene on your own by going into each character one by one, or hand over the headset for the next actor in the room to take over. Record the final scene and it saves locally to disk or optionally auto-upload to YouTube into a private video ready to be published. 

Mindshow has already released several updates providing new scene environments, characters, and props. I can't wait to see what the come up with in the future.

36176720.review:
Incredibly polished and FREE title that keeps the updates coming. The tutorial is quick and painless and instantly showcases some of the posibilities in creating your own Mindshow.

Pros
+High quality polish with a AAA feel
+Large, and growing, variety of characters/props/environments
+Intuitive system lets you easily create a show and control multiple characters

Cons
-Limited to 30 second clips. Video editing required for anything longer or more complicated
-Surprising lack of camera options, unable to pause and change camera view during recording
-Tutorial, while well made, is relatively light on teaching and you are left wondering if there are options you are missing while making your show.

This title is a must own for anyone who owns VR and enjoys creating content. To be honest I would gladly pay for this once it is released with more features. 

Early Access Score 9/10

https://youtu.be/pi4NGcgxcYE

Mindshow is an animation app. In Mindshow you can make 3D animated shorts or shows, using a range of sets and characters which are provided for you, and then share them online (immediately from within the app if you wish to). The characters and sets are well designed, and there are also some props available. The app is simple to use, with a quick tutorial teaching you how to use Mindshow and all of it's features. The app makes it easy for users to start creating by providing some ’starter shows’. Mindshow is in early-access, and is constantly improving with the introduction of new characters, sets, props, and a Mindshow team which is very responsive to users. There is even a Mindshow YouTube channel where the Mindshow team shares community content and hosts competitions for users. Overall, Mindshow is an extremely enjoyable, fun to use, user friendly, and unique VR animation platform. Oh and it's also FREE!

35174565.review:
Best free game ever? 

This is an incredible experience for the VR. I bought this with Elite: Dangerous, which was $30. 4 hours later, my friends and I are still playing this. These guys should be charging much more than they are. 

Mindshow allows you to make short little movies in VR. They have a lot of characters and scenes to choose from, some voice altering, and you pretty much let the creative juices flow. I had been starting to get bored with VR games and voila, we get another groundbreaking thing. If you ever played 3D Movie Maker, that old movie maker program for Windows 95, it's like that for the new generation. Brilliant. And hilarious. Maybe the best time you'll have in a while in VR. 

There are still some bugs. We lost the ability to move around sometimes and had to restart the game. But so far, it's a blast and probably one of the only games I'd keep coming back to. Is it worth $0? You better damn well get this game while it's free (as of writing this).

34908292.review:
It's honestly quite amazing how ingenious this little peice of software is, and for the low price of absolutely free I'd say it's very definitely worth checking out. While the interface can be a bit fidgety on the Oculus, the sheer joy of acting like a complete lunatic and creative collaborative improv with yourself or others is infectious.

The environment you stage your shows in and the character designs for the puppets you can inhabit are top notch, and honestly I'd say it's worth a download if only to check them out. If you're looking to use the software for its intended purpose, however, you're in for a great time. Everything about the presentation is smooth and slick and it's hard not to get carried away just throwing improv ideas at the wall and seeing what sticks.

There's plenty of room to expand upon the existing content - more themed characters would be extremely welcomed, or even the ability to customise a generic character with accessories and different bodyparts in order to fit your scene. As a proof of concept for a brilliantly fun animation gadget, however, Mindshow excels. Highly reccomended for those looking for something new to do.

34837947.review:
Mindshow ist eine der wenigen VR-Applikationen, bei denen die Entwickler einen völlig neuen Gedankengang verfolgt haben: 
Du hast diese Idee für einen kurzen Sketch oder einen Animationsfilm. Du weißt genau, wie die Figuren sich bewegen, was sie sagen sollen. Mit Mindshow kannst Du diese Idee professionell zum Leben erwecken. Du bist Dein eigener Regisseur, Deine Schauspieler, Dein Kameramann, Dein Drehbuchschreiber und Dein Bühnenbildner. Mindshow ist Dein Werkzeug und die Grenzen setzt Dir nur Deine Phantasie.
Ob Du Deine Show von Grund auf selber erstellst, oder einen Part in der Show eines anderen übernimmst. Ob Du per Greenscreen aus den vorgegebenen Kulissen ausbrichst oder ungewöhnliche Perspektiven in diesen entdeckst. Probier einfach, was Dir gefällt, und vergiss nicht, Deine Resultate auf Youtube oder Facebook mit den anderen zu teilen.

34764814.review:
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1128883466

I made that video in about 10-15 minutes.  It was incredibly simple and intuitive but most of all, fun!  Mindshow is amazing and really gets your imagination flowing with the various props, settings, and characters you're given access to.  My 8 year old daughter ended up absolutely loving Mindshow and she has made about 10 videos herself already.  

I do have some minor gripes and that mainly consists of the frequency of bugs I've encountered, most of them ending up forcing me to exit the game and reload it.  Sometimes the software no longer allows me to control or move a character, seemingly at random.  Other times, I can't get past the calibration when it asks me to hold my arms out to my sides because it freezes up.  I'd say these glitches/bugs happen once in a while but more often than not, Mindshow works just fine.

I think it would be amazing if the devs added a feature to add multiple cameras you can place around the scene so that you can capture the action from various angles all at once rather than having to manually record the scene multiple times for each camera angle you want to have.  This feature could also output a separate video file for each camera/angle to make it easier for us to edit them into one video.  That would be amazing!

All in all, Mindshow makes me incredibly excited to be an owner of a VR headset because this is just not something you can experience with any other medium and it's so much fun!  I can't believe this is free.  If you haven't checked out Mindshow yet, you're really missing out.

34724781.review:
I am absolutely loving this application so far.  I have a couple of comments and suggestions for the developers but before that, here are three short clips I made with this software yesterday: 

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL6pKLYta47afVdovc3D3T5mTa3QX1RgU8

What I love:

-The auto smoothed camera movements when recording
-The amazingly well done inverse kinematics
-Extremely easy to use UI for expressions and an amazing display of using blend shapes to do so
-The very quick rendering time for videos
-The idea overall

(Keep in mind, I realize this is early access and many of these features are probably ALREADY in development, but just in case, here are my thoughts!)

What I would love too see improved or added in order of importance (top to bottom: most to least)

1. Allow the user to add on to a current animation by using the slider to start the time at which they would like to resume recording.  This way we wouldn't have to completely overwrite our movement recordings for a character if we want to add more.

2. Allow the user to preview the video they just shot BEFORE rendering it.  This is a big one for me as I am a perfectionist and I do not want to wait for a render every time I try a new camera technique.

3. Allow longer recording time.  This one seems obvious, but I would really love to set my own limits based on my machine's capabilities and memory.

4. Allow more characters in one scene.  Yes, this can become noisy and intensive, but with this being said, I would also recommend allowing for a muted mic setting for background characters.  I would love to be able to add characters that have no speaking parts, but just do idle things in the background.  This may cause lag, but that should be left up to the user to decide.

5.  It would be great to allow users to import their own 3d environments, for instance an option to import a custom .fbx with a navigation mesh build in.  This would be for advanced users, and may be more of a steam workshop detail, but I think it would be great.

6. Just in my opinion, it may be more user friendly to allow the handheld ui (on the right hand) to pop up on touching the thumbpad (not when applying pressure, just touching), and be selected on press down, rather than how the UI currently only shows up if you press and hold down the thumbpad, navigate to the option,  and the option is selected on press up.  Again, just my opinion based on what I think is a more user centered design.

7. While I like the built in camera smoothing, it may be interesting to give the user the option to turn it off for a more deliberately shaky, documentary style video.  With this, it would be nice to give the option to zoom in/out, as well as focus in/out.

8. Lastly, allow for users to stitch multiple camera clips from different angles in the same scene.  Now, this one would technically be higher up the list for me, but I also realize that this can be quite easily done via external software, so for that reason, it may not be as important.

And that's that!  I will update if I come accross any other suggestion.  I hope this reaches the developers well.  This is a really great, well made application, and perfect idea for VR.  I will be following this project and I can't wait to see future developments!

34695582.review:
This is one of those rare VR titles that makes you smile.  It's like discovering an entirely new use for VR.  Simulations that allow you to create your own cartoons have been around for awhile, but using VR to automate the process makes a lot of sense, and Mindshow automates much of the drudgery.

This software will be of interest to people at any end of the spectrum, whether you just want to goof around, or you'd like to create some fancy, polished production, Mindshow has the potential to make it easier.   What's pretty cool is that even with the small quantity of mediocre sample content, it's easy to see there's much more potential here.

I originally thought this might be some sort of real time, interactive chat thing, but it seems for now, this is a single player experience where you create a scene and then overdub multiple characters into the scene.  In this earlyl version, you're only limited to 30 second clips, and there's limited functionality, but it shows a lot of potential.  If they create a way for people to make their own avatars... then it becomes a KILLER APP.  The kind that would justify the purchase of a VR system on its own.

VR is the future of democratized 3D animation - and this app is the first true pioneer. 

Mindshow is intuitive, powerful, and stunningly beautiful, and at the time of writing this review it's still in early access! There's so much to come and I'm SO excited to see where this is going to go, but even in it's current state there's little in creative VR that rivals this.

My admiration and gratitude go to these developers who listen to their users, create fantastic content, and go the extra mile to interact and communicate with their community. 

If you're a creative soul or a performer at heart you will immediately fall in love with mindshow - and if you don't consider yourself either of those things - try it out anyway because the experience will probably change your mind about that when you surprise yourself by how quickly you'll lose your inhibitions and become an instant movie star wannabe.

34679526.review:
My 10 year old daughter and I create goofy stories using Toontastic on the IPad, and we crack up watching our cheesy animations and voice-acting. Using Mindshow, and within a few minutes, we were creating goofy videos in VR that had us on the floor laughing like lunatics. We LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this application; we're so impressed. The walk-thru to get you started is extremely polished and entertaining. I’m going to do my part to make sure these developers make lots and lots of money; they truly deserve it.  

My only disappointment is I was hoping to be able to create a more polished video from within Mindshow instead of exporting clips and doing post production in movie-maker for things like editing, mood music and sound effects. The genius of Mindshow lis it has made 3-d character animation with voice acting easier than post production.  

I offer the following ideas for future releases:

1.	Incorporate sound effects and mood music.
2.	Allow the user to pause the recording, reposition the camera, and resume recording instead 
   of generating a new  video for every recording. 
3.	Allow users to create a simple title and credit scene.
4.	Render one final video, for those that want it. 

This will allow those users who don’t use tools like “Movie Maker” to create a complete product from within Mindshow, but will still allow the savvier users all of the flexibility they have now.  I recommend that the Devs play with “Toontastic” on IOS to see how the users of that program are guided through to a polished result. 

Mindshow is a Fantastic Product made for everyone, and it’s a huge hit with our family.

34669363.review:
This is something I've been waiting for since I've used tracked controllers in VR. As an animator and filmmaker (who also likes to (voice)act every once in a while), this is an amazing tool.

Of course, it's really limited at the moment. It kind of reminds me of Microsoft 3D Film Maker from the 90s: A simple game-like software where you can mix and match different characters to make your own movies.

What really exceeded my expectations is the polish so far: The inverse kinematics work a treat and the procedural animation for the non-tracked parts of the body (torso, legs) is super solid - way better than in most games.

While I will have a lot of fun with this and I think this is just an amazing piece of software, I would really love for it to not just go the "pay for new items" route but also eventually make it possible to import your own artwork, create your own lighting, etc.. Only then will it live up to its potential for more ambitious users.

Until then though, there is still a lot of fun to be had!

IMPROV,. this is a title you just have to have in your library!  being able to set up your own scene and then act it out and then set more actors and jump into them and act,.. with yourself is just a blast!  I was talking to my son about how much fun this could be with a group, playing improv games, one character is played by one person, then you put someone else in the scene and let them play off of the firrst and see where it goes! 

Currently, in early access, you have a set of predone sets and situations you can act off of with some pre recorded actors, or if you like you can pick from a variety of sets, pic up to 3 of several different character models to place as you like in the set, and several props the characters can interact with.  you imagination is the limit!   It seems you are limited to 30 second scenes but that's ok.  Above I posted a short I did for my buddy who just had his first daughter, in the longer scene at the beginning I just recorded several scenes and spliced them together.  nothing fancy just windows movie maker.  After you lay out and act out your scenes you then have a virtual camera you can use to direct and record from any where in the scene.  which is really cool.  I also noticed it uses positional audio which is another plus.  

animation is just plain intuitive since you just act the scene out and your character model seamlessly moves with you.  their mouths move when you talk, and your right track pad has four facial emotions to give the characters more visual depth.  A couple of the models have voice filters which actually I would love to see more of.  Or the ability to peg a filter to a specific character like a woman for dudes to use and so on.   There arn't any sound effects to add, which is something else I would bet is coming in the future of this title.  

Ok this is a free title as of now so you really have no excuse but to download and try.  Things I would like to see in future builds.  More environments, possilby customizable, more characters,. also a character model builder so you could make your own, a sound booth or something so you could add music and sound effects to your scenes.  maybe more than 3 characters as well but if you are creative you can get around that limit.  

Do yourself a favor and download this title! have FUN!!!

34636036.review:
Another great example of the many uses that VR offers. This software essentially offers what you could consider a Source Filmmaker "LITE". Instead of tediously animating rigs frame by frame, you can hop into any character and act out a scene and export it within a few minutes so that you can later edit together a longer video in post.


If you're not into the idea of making actual videos, this is app is just pure fun. There's even potential to turn this into a "madlibs" style party game. Drop in some characters, have players take turns with the headset, act out a scene and leave some conversational gaps for the next player to fill in. Ends up being ridiculous and fun to playback.


There's a ton of potential here and Mindshow is still missing a ton of features. It seems pretty clear that they will remain a free app with the option to purchase more models and scenery but it would be awesome to see them offer more tools that allow "advanced controls" for making longer clips, allowing camera zooms (and maybe even different simulated lenses), lighting options, and hopefully even the ability to import custom models.

The base app as it is currently is a huge win for everyone and provides just enough free content to where casual players can hop in and enjoy it immediately. At the price of FREE, there's no reason this should be getting negative reviews and you shouldn't try this out now.

34617947.review:
This software is amazing!  There are some limitations currently, but there is a ton of potential for really good content creation here.  You videos are currently limited to single 30 second takes, and you can't have multiple people acting at the same time.  There's also a limited number of sets, models, and props with no way to make or add your own.  Still, there's plenty of stuff here to start getting creative.  If you like making videos or sketches then this is a must-have, and for free... you can't go wrong. 

I'm really looking forward to seeing this app mature.  It's the most interesting VR software that I've used, and I imagine we'll see some womderful content being made with it in the future.
